intro: Moraea louisabolusiae, commonly known as the Louisabole Mountain Moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is a perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces its flowers in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
